protocols.name: CLIENT PROPOSAL GENERATION
protocols.purpose: Turn job posts into winning proposals that get you hired.
invariants: Only mention experience you actually have. Don't lie.

protocols.name: CLIENT DISCOVERY INITIATION
protocols.purpose: Structured client discovery to validate scope, requirements, and expectations.
invariants: Do not advance to planning deliverables until every discovery question is answered and validated with the client.

protocols.name: PROJECT BRIEF CREATION
protocols.purpose: Convert validated discovery intelligence into an implementation-ready Project Brief.
invariants: Do not finalize the brief without recorded client approval and reconciliation against discovery scope.

protocols.name: PROJECT BOOTSTRAP AND CONTEXT ENGINEERING
protocols.purpose: Bootstrap governed scaffold, validate environment baseline, and initialize context kit.
invariants: Never modify existing production application code or delete repository assets outside governed directories.

protocols.name: BOOTSTRAP YOUR PROJECT (Legacy Alignment)
protocols.purpose: Align legacy bootstrap with governed scaffold and configure AI governance tooling.
invariants: Do not edit or delete production application files; all modifications remain within governed directories.

protocols.name: IMPLEMENTATION-READY PRD CREATION
protocols.purpose: Create PRD with user stories, functional/technical specs, risks, and validation plan.
invariants: Do not write production code; deliver documentation only.

protocols.name: TECHNICAL DESIGN & ARCHITECTURE
protocols.purpose: Transform PRD into validated technical architecture (boundaries, ADRs, design).
invariants: Do not introduce components/integrations that lack grounding in the brief or PRD.

protocols.name: TECHNICAL TASK GENERATION
protocols.purpose: Transform validated PRD/design into executable task plan with dependencies and automation hooks.
invariants: Do not author production code; produce structured task documentation only.

protocols.name: ENVIRONMENT SETUP & VALIDATION
protocols.purpose: Provision, validate, and document consistent development environment aligned with design.
invariants: Do not declare the environment ready until validation passes on a clean baseline and credentials are verified.

protocols.name: CONTROLLED TASK EXECUTION
protocols.purpose: Execute approved task plan with governance, quality gates, and evidence capture.
invariants: Do not modify tasks outside the authorized task file or skip quality gates; progress must remain auditable.

protocols.name: INTEGRATION TESTING & SYSTEM VALIDATION
protocols.purpose: Validate cross-service workflows, interfaces, and data flows using production-like conditions.
invariants: Do not grant integration readiness unless all critical paths and contracts pass with evidence logged.

protocols.name: QUALITY AUDIT ORCHESTRATOR
protocols.purpose: Orchestrate correct review protocol, execute pre-audit automation, consolidate audit record.
invariants: DO NOT bypass pre-audit automation or deliver reports without executing the selected specialized protocol end-to-end.

protocols.name: USER ACCEPTANCE TESTING (UAT) COORDINATION
protocols.purpose: Orchestrate customer-facing validation cycles to confirm business requirements are met.
invariants: DO NOT declare UAT complete without recorded stakeholder approvals, resolved blocking feedback, and updated release documentation.

protocols.name: PRE-DEPLOYMENT VALIDATION & STAGING READINESS
protocols.purpose: Validate staging parity, rehearse deployment & rollback, document readiness.
invariants: DO NOT issue production go/no-go package without staging parity and successful deployment+rollback rehearsals with evidence.

protocols.name: PRODUCTION DEPLOYMENT & RELEASE MANAGEMENT
protocols.purpose: Orchestrate production deployments with zero unplanned downtime and full auditability.
invariants: DO NOT deploy to production without staging success, stakeholder approval, and executable rollback plan.

protocols.name: POST-DEPLOYMENT MONITORING & OBSERVABILITY
protocols.purpose: Activate, validate, and tune observability systems after deployment.
invariants: DO NOT declare monitoring complete until rules, dashboards, and runbooks validated against live telemetry.

protocols.name: INCIDENT RESPONSE & ROLLBACK
protocols.purpose: Coordinate detection, mitigation, and resolution of production incidents with rollback.
invariants: DO NOT perform rollback without confirming severity, scope, and stakeholder alignment.

protocols.name: PERFORMANCE OPTIMIZATION & TUNING
protocols.purpose: Detect, analyze, and remediate performance bottlenecks via telemetry and load testing.
invariants: DO NOT deploy performance changes without reproducible benchmarking evidence and SLO instrumentation.

protocols.name: DOCUMENTATION & KNOWLEDGE TRANSFER
protocols.purpose: Capture, validate, and distribute durable knowledge for independent execution.
invariants: Never declare documentation complete until all consumers confirm access and gaps=0.

protocols.name: PROJECT CLOSURE & HANDOVER
protocols.purpose: Verify deliverables, secure approvals, formalize ownership, retire governance with evidence.
invariants: Do not close project until all deliverables, finances, and handover items have signed approvals and evidence.

protocols.name: CONTINUOUS MAINTENANCE & SUPPORT PLANNING
protocols.purpose: Translate closure outputs into a living maintenance program with governance cadence.

quality_gates.name: Maintenance Backlog Integrity
quality_gates.pass_threshold: All critical items have owner+due date

invariants: Do not finalize plan without explicit commitments for every critical item, SLA target, optimization backlog.

protocols.name: IMPLEMENTATION RETROSPECTIVE
protocols.purpose: Synthesize cross-phase learnings and produce prioritized improvement plan.
invariants: Do not conclude until every critical action item has owner, due date, follow-up protocol.

protocols.name: SCRIPT GOVERNANCE
protocols.purpose: Validate, audit, and enforce consistency across operational scripts without modifying them.
invariants: Do not modify or execute scripts directly; only validate, analyze, and report.

protocols.name: CLIENT DISCOVERY (ALTERNATE TRACK)
protocols.purpose: Execute an evidence-driven discovery cycle when legacy engagements need rapid intake without disrupting governed scaffolds.

quality_gates.name: Clarification Resolution
quality_gates.pass_threshold: Critical gaps resolved or logged with owner

invariants: Do not progress into implementation; alternate discovery remains informational until validated.
All assumptions must be documented with risk and mitigation owner.

protocols.name: PROTOCOL INTEGRATION MAP (DOCUMENTATION)
protocols.purpose: Document end-to-end protocol sequencing, dependencies, and evidence flow for the governed workflow.

quality_gates.name: Quality Gate Alignment
quality_gates.pass_threshold: All 18 gates linked to upstream/downstream owners

invariants: Only document integrations that are validated and approved.
All deviations from core workflow must include rationale and control owner.

protocols.name: INTEGRATION GUIDE (DOCUMENTATION)
protocols.purpose: Translate the integration map into actionable guidance for operators, highlighting critical checkpoints and tooling steps.
invariants: Do not publish guidance without confirming tooling paths and authentication steps.
Each checkpoint must cite upstream protocol evidence.

protocols.name: VALIDATION GUIDE (DOCUMENTATION)
protocols.purpose: Describe validator operations, scoring, and remediation triggers for all protocols and automation gates.
invariants: Never publish validator instructions without linking to authoritative evidence packages.
Escalation triggers must include owners, SLAs, and tooling references.

protocols.name: META-VALIDATION OPERATIONS
protocols.purpose: Coordinate validator orchestration, evidence packaging, and upgrade readiness checks across the entire workflow.
invariants: Never certify a meta-upgrade without recorded evidence across all validation dimensions.
All findings must loop into governance backlog with owner, due date, and mitigation.
